Higher interest rates are also necessary to attract foreign investors and borrowers to the US in order to finance Mr Trump's infrastructure spending. This would also put upward pressure on the US Dollar which already can be seen. If Mr Trump is, in addition to that, pursuing a more protectionist trade policy, then both domestic prices as well as currency value of the US Dollar vis-a-vis the Euro and the Renminbi will increase. US i.e. the US loses competitiveness. Americans will also find that credit financing for e.g. houses will become more expensive. This will then act as a break on consumption and work against the demand impulse from government spending. In the longer term, both effects might cancel each other out and the US economy will have higher price levels but not necessarily more employment.
